item.title: si, soy vegetariano
item.description: Muchísimas veces mis amigos, familia, o simples desconocidos me han preguntado ¿Por qué soy vegetariano? La respuesta corta es porque si!, la respuesta larga está aquí.

item.title: On references, change and standardisation
item.description: In the last week I wasted half a day fixing citations for a journal paper. HALF-A-DAY that I could have spent doing actual research! Here is what we should do about it.

item.title: HOME/SICK launch @ SCIENCE GALLERY
item.description: All the pieces of the exhibition

item.title: LIFELOGGING launch party
item.description: Last Thursday I attended the launch party for the [Science Gallery’s][1] upcoming exhibition entitled [#LIFELOGGING.][2]   Let me first put this into context. The science gallery is one of my favourite museums in the world, and definetly one of my favourite places in Dublin. It manages to put together great show s where art and science not only mix, but fades together for three months. A truly collaborative enriching experience for both disciplines. This exhibition is my favourite so far, and I wrote about it for my friends at [THE ISSUE][3]. Read the full entry on their website!

item.title: recsys challenge : part III
item.description: In the last two posts about the recsys challenge  ([part][1] I and [part II][2]) I have discussed in detail some aspects of this year’s challenge data. This time I present an analysis of the data from the point of view of categories and the role they play in clicks, sessions and buys.

item.title: recsys challenge: part II
item.description: After my first entry on the recsys challenge ([recsys challenge: part I][1]) , I now show analyse some time patterns more in depth. It is important to understand when do people browse and buy?, to include that information in our model (if that turns out to be valuable)

item.title: recsys challenge: part I
item.description: [RecSys’15][1] is ready to roll! We have a date, a venue, a call for papers, and, of course, a challenge. Last November, the details for this year’s RecSys challenge were announced, and the leaderboards are already getting submissions (more info in the [RecSys’15 website][2] and the [challenge website][3])

item.title: A Weekend of Art in San Francisco
item.description: Last October I spent 10 days in San Francisco, my friends at [THE ISSUE magazine][1] were kind enough to publish my art review of a weekend in the city. Featuring the most interesting museums and the new exhibition @large from Ai Weiwei in Alcatraz, you can read it in their [blog][1].

item.title: Ryan McGinley, perpetua y dinámica juventud y belleza
black, gone.
item.description:
Your pictures are gone,
and so is my love,
my friendship, my willingness.
And so are all my failed efforts to evolve.
gone, gone, gone!
